Key Arguments: The legislation attacks free speech under the guise of protection.
The government and media have been the main sources of misinformation.
The legislation would stifle public debate and criticism of the government.
It creates a 'ministry of truth' reminiscent of Orwell's 1984.
The definitions of 'harm' are broad and open to abuse.
The legislation could lead to de-platforming of individuals with dissenting views.
Main Themes: Criticism of government and media narratives
Notable Quotes: This legislation is possibly the worst I have seen in my life, bar none.
This act is the deliberate and wilful decision of government to suffocate criticism and prevent debate in our nation.
This legislation is the stuff of Mao, Stalin, Hitler and Mussolini.
